newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon's property tax revenues rise in March.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon's property tax revenues rise in March.

text.p: Lebanese government revenues from taxation of property deals rose 14.65 percent in March over the same month last year, the finance ministry said on Monday.
The ministry collected $13,325,928 compared with $11,623,486 in March 1996. It collected $8.292 million last month, the ministry said in a statement.
Collected revenues for the first three months of 1997 totalled $32,685,065 compared with $28,153,611 over the same period a year earlier -- a rise of 16.10 percent.

Tax rates on property deals vary from district to district, but average about 6.5 percent. However, tax collection does not truly reflect the state of the market because deals are sometimes understated to avoid tax, property analysts said.
The dollar figures are based on the following exchange rates:
